intro: Pedicularis siphonantha var. delavayi, commonly known as the Delavay's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The species is characterized by its striking purple to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapting to its cold, mountainous environment. This plant is often found in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in nutrient-poor soils.
